medical_history.chief_complaint: 1 day of abdominal pain with associated nausea and bilious emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began last evening with acute onset of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain after the patient woke from sleep. The patient developed nausea with bilious emesis the following morning, accompanied by chills. There were no prior episodes reported. Symptoms intensity is not quantified in the given data.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HTN (diet/exercise controlled), reported history of thalassemia, obesity, multi-nodular goiter, eczema, history of herniated disc (lumbar), history of ovarian cysts, asthma, right rotator cuff surgery, lumbar back disc surgery.
